property.name: text
property.value: A model that simulates a collision avidance scenario, where one robot estimates the location of stationary obstacles and moves to origin (0,0). The robot runs an internal Particle Filter to estimate the obstacle's positions and calculates the path to keep the distance from obstacles greater than "minDistanceLimit". Since the robot is controlled by acceleration, it optimizes acceleration controls as long as "predict_TimeHorizon". If the time horizon is 1 step, it is difficult for the robot to keep constraints of distances to obstacles.

property.name: text
property.value: Model motion where the orientation changes at a constant rate and the speed is fixed.

property.name: text
property.value: Number of Perticles used in ParticleFilter (in the distributed version).

property.name: text
property.value: Constraints of speed (used in the distributed version).

property.name: text
property.value: Input values from Central Computation Node. (Array of accelerations for all robots.)

property.name: text
property.value: Robot motion depending on the acceleration input.

property.name: text
property.value: Model of sensor on the robot. Measuring the 2D position of the intruder.

property.name: text
property.value: Measuring the current position of this robot.

property.name: text
property.value: The frequency of measurement is depending on the number of objects.

entity.name: CompositeOptimizerUsingGradient
entity.doc: Optimize the objective function provided in the inside composite, subject to constraints and precision/iteration limits

svg.text: Provide a model that computes f(x) from x where f(x) is the term to be minimized. Also provide a model to compute g(x) from x, where the constraints on the minimization are g(x) >= 0.
